page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW - SULLINGTON
page.content: This area comprises the southern half of the sprawling parish of Sullington. It is a very pleasant rural area north of the South Downs between two villages, Storrington and Washington. Country roads lead to the Southdown Way which runs along the top of the downs. At Chantry Post, 189 feet above sea level, one can enjoy panoramic views of the surroundign countryside and southwards to the sea. A walk through the farmyard of Sullington Manor, with its ancient tithe barn leads to the Parish Church, part of which dates from Saxon times. St. Mary's Church at Washington is also worth visiting. On the Eastern boundary the dual carriageway facilities travel southward to Worthing and to Horsham in the North.
